NAME: Grace Hopper
INFO: Grace Brewster Murray Hopper was an American computer scientist and United States Navy rear admiral.

NAME: Ada Lovelace
INFO: Ada Lovelace was an English mathematician and writer chiefly known for her work on Charles Babbage's proposed mechanical general-purpose computer the Analytical Engine.

NAME: Elizebeth Friedman
INFO: Elizebeth Smith Friedman was an expert cryptanalyst and pioneer in U.S. cryptography.

NAME: Jessica O. Matthews
INFO: She got her first patent at age 19!

NAME: Anita Borg
INFO: She founded the Institute for Women and Technology and the Grace Hopper Celebration of Women in Computing.

NAME: Katherine Johnson
INFO: Katherine Coleman Goble Johnson is an African-American mathematician whose calculations of orbital mechanics as a NASA employee were critical to the success of the first and subsequent U.S. manned spaceflights.

NAME: Annie Easley
INFO: Annie J. Easley was an African-American computer and rocket scientist.

NAME: Simone Giertz

NAME: Ayah Bdeir
INFO: Ayah Bdeir is an entrepreneur and inventor. She is the founder and CEO of littleBits.

NAME: Ayanna Howard
INFO: Ayanna Howard is an American roboticist and the School Chair for Interactive Computing at the Georgia Institute of Technology.
